meanings.definition: A woman who provides food and drink at social events.
meanings.sent1: The cateress prepared delicious snacks for the party.
meanings.sent2: The cateress served refreshing drinks to the guests.
meanings.sent3: The cateress made sure everyone had enough to eat and drink at the gathering.
meanings.sent4: The cateress was like a culinary magician, delighting everyone with her creations.
meanings.sent5: The cateress's spread of food and drinks was a feast for the eyes as well as the stomach.

meanings.definition: To provide food and drink for a social event.
meanings.sent1: She will cateress the company picnic next week.
meanings.sent2: They decided to cateress the wedding reception for convenience.
meanings.sent3: He promised to cateress the school dance with his famous homemade cookies.
meanings.sent4: The restaurant will cateress the charity event with a variety of dishes.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to cateress the community barbecue, ensuring everyone had a great time.
